physical_examinations.relevant_findings: On admission, the patient appeared pale, short, and thin. He seemed to be in a semi-somnolent state, 'in a fog', with very little affect, flaccid handshakes, and jerky movements. He expressed suicidal ideas and showed hopelessness. Tendon reflexes bilaterally were mildly hyperactive. No Babinski or Romberg sign was noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After ECT on Nov. 19, the patient appeared more outgoing and aggressive initially. However, after his third ECT on Nov. 23, he developed confusion and a wide, somewhat staggering gait, indicating a progressive neurological disturbance.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination revealed obesity, some hair loss on the head, and general increased body hair with hirsutism of the chin and chest. Neurological examination showed no abnormality.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After 4 months in the hospital, the patient became increasingly disturbed with more frequent outbursts of sexually aggressive behavior.
